channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Home remodeling costs jump in the second quarter
item.description: If it seems like it’s getting more expensive to replace a broken door, kitchen fixtures, or upgrade a major appliance, you’re not wrong. The cost of h...

item.title: Government Shutdown: SBA to Furlough 23 Percent of Staff. Here’s What Services Will End
item.description: Federal agencies are bracing for a potential government shutdown as negotiations stall on Capitol Hill.

item.title: The ‘Warren Buffett Indicator’ has surged above 200%, meaning the market’s price is far ahead of the economy’s size
item.description: Buffett has likened investing in this environment to "playing with fire."

item.title: Trump says U.S. cities should be ‘training grounds’ for the military to fight an ‘invasion from within’ during unusual speech to generals
item.description: The military leaders sat mostly stone-faced through Trump’s politicized remarks.

item.title: Single mother sues — and beats — Kentucky for kicking her off food stamps because she bought food at the store where she worked
item.description: Franklin County Judge Thomas Wingate said it was "draconian" without "clear and convincing evidence that intentional trafficking was occurring."

item.title: Why whiskey collectors are flocking to Unicorn’s $125 million marketplace
item.description: In the early days of the internet, collectors traded rare whiskey and wine on eBay alongside Beanie Babies and vintage sneakers. But then, in 1999, si...

item.title: Starbucks store closings: 59 unionized locations on doomed list in coffee chain restructuring
item.description: On the heels of Starbucks’ recent announcement it will be cutting 900 corporate roles and closing 1% of its Northern American stores by the end of 202...

item.title: Job openings barely climb in August as the job market stays in an awkward place
item.description: U.S. job openings were essentially unchanged million last month amid economic uncertainty arising from President Donald Trump’s trade policies and an ...

item.title: ‘AI for America’ wants to be a New Deal for workers and communities. But it needs teeth
item.description: Curing cancer. Reducing carbon emissions. Maximizing business efficiency. To achieve all this and develop untold social goods, artificial intelligence...

item.title: 2 Studies Say Gen Z’s Values Are Hurting Their Job Prospects
item.description: A new analysis says only 2 percent of the youngest workforce cohort share values that employers seek in recruits, sparking fierce debate.

item.title: Why Major Workplace Disruptions Aren’t Always a Bad Thing
item.description: Workers’ trust in company leadership can be boosted if you handle a business crisis smoothly.

item.title: Recruiters caution against using AI to write job postings because it’s been trained on ‘crappy’ descriptions
item.description: Using AI might be a time-saver, but it also robs the company of the ability to think deeply about what a job requires.

item.title: ‘Mega bankruptcies’ are the highest they’ve been since the pandemic began, up 33% since last year alone
item.description: Continued inflation, high interest rates, falling consumer demand, tariffs, and uncertain policy shifts are driving the increase in bankruptcies.

item.title: How Pop Mart Is Using Disney’s Playbook to Boost Its Labubu Success
item.description: The Chinese company is taking lessons from the entertainment giant when it comes to growth.

item.title: Why This Top Trade Representative Doesn’t See ‘Any Problems From Tariffs’
